meanings.definition: To caution or advise against something
meanings.sent1: She was admonishing her friend to be careful while crossing the street.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was admonishing the students to study for the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started admonishing the cat to stay away from its cage.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse stood tall, admonishing ships of the dangerous rocks ahead.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl sat in the tree, admonishing the young birds to listen and learn.

meanings.definition: Serving as a warning or reprimand
meanings.sent1: The admonishing look on her face made him realize he had made a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds in the sky had an admonishing presence, warning of an impending storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave an admonishing meow when the dog tried to steal its toy.
meanings.sent4: The painting on the wall had an admonishing quality, as if watching over the room.
meanings.sent5: The old sign had an admonishing tone, reminding visitors to respect the historical site.
